solution_line_template: The {num_vip_tickets} VIP tickets amount to ${cost_per_vip_ticket} x {num_vip_tickets} = $<<{cost_per_vip_ticket}*{num_vip_tickets}={cost_vip_tickets}>>{cost_vip_tickets}.

The {num_regular_tickets} regular tickets amount to ${cost_per_regular_ticket} x {num_regular_tickets} = $<<{cost_per_regular_ticket}*{num_regular_tickets}={cost_regular_tickets}>>{cost_regular_tickets}.
Thus, the total cost of the tickets is ${cost_vip_tickets} + ${cost_regular_tickets} = $<<{cost_vip_tickets}+{cost_regular_tickets}={total_ticket_cost}>>{total_ticket_cost}.
Therefore, Mrs. Wilsborough is left with ${initial_savings} - ${total_ticket_cost} = $<<{initial_savings}-{total_ticket_cost}={remaining_savings}>>{remaining_savings} of her savings.
